mfm.fitting.models.tcspc.anisotropy module¶

mfm.fitting.models.tcspc.dye_diffusion module¶

class mfm.fitting.models.tcspc.dye_diffusion.DyeDecay(tau0=4.2, k_quench_protein=5.0, n_photons=10000000.0, attachment_residue=None, attachment_atom=None, attachment_chain=None, dg=0.5, sticky_mode='quencher', save_av=True, diffusion_coefficient=7.1, slow_fact=0.1, critical_distance=7.0, output_file='out', av_parameter={'linker_width': 0.5, 'linker_length': 20.0, 'radius1': 3.5}, quencher={'TRP': ['CB'], 'PRO': ['CB'], 'HIS': ['CB'], 'TYR': ['CB']}, t_max=500.0, t_step=0.05, slow_radius=10.0, decay_mode='curve', n_curves=10000, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: mfm.fitting.models.Model, mfm.curve.Curve

attachment_atom_name¶
attachment_chain¶
attachment_residue¶
av¶

The accessible volume used to calculate the decay. If this is not provided or set it is calculated at the first access using calc_av()

av_parameter¶
calc_av(**kwargs)[source]¶
Parameters:kwargs – verbose (bool)
Returns:
calc_photons(verbose=False, donor_traj=None, kQ=None)[source]¶

n_ph: number of generated photons pq: quenching probability if distance of fluorphore is below the critical_distance

collisions¶

Relative number of collided frames (That are frames below the critical distance)

decay_mode¶

This defines the way the time-resolved fluorescence is calculated. This parameter should be either photon or curve. If it is photon a Poisson process is simulated if curve the quenching rate is integrated to obtain a smooth curve.

diffusion¶

Diffusion simulation of type SimulateDiffusion. If no trajectory is simulated yet it will be simulated after calling the attribute.

diffusion_coefficient¶
get_histogram(**kwargs)[source]¶

Returns two arrays one is the time axis and one is the photon-counts

Parameters:kwargs – Takes nbins the number of histogram bins, range the histogram range, decay_mode the

way the histogram gets generated: either photon or curve. If this parameter is photon the histogram will be the result of the simulation of a Poisson process. If it is curve the sum of smooth curves will be returned based on several integrated quenched rates.

kQ¶
n_curves¶

The number of decay-curves used to calculate a smooth decay (number of samples of the simulation)

n_photons¶
photon_trace¶

The photon trace of the simulation. If it is None (default after initialization) it is calculated using the method calc_photons()

quantum_yield¶

Relative quantum yield of the compared to the unquenched dye

quencher¶

get_lifetime_spectrum(rDA, pRDA, d0_lifetime_spectrum)[source]¶

Get the lifetime-spectrum of a distance-distribution given the the lifetime-spectrum a donor reference sample

Parameters:
  • rDA – numpy-array A 1D array of distances
  • pRDA – numpy-array A 1D array of probabilities
  • d0_lifetime_spectrum – numpy-array A interleaved lifetime-spectrum
Returns:

numpy-array A interleaved lifetime-spectrum given the distance distribution
get_pRDA(**kwargs)[source]¶

This re-calculates the probability distribution of the distances

Parameters:kwargs –

optional parameters If an optional parameters is not provided the parameters value is taken form the attribute of the class-instance

inversion_method: string
The applied inversion method: either ‘nnls’ for non-negativity least squares with Thikonov regularization or ‘lstsq’ for truncated singulart value decomposition
regularization_factor: float
The used regularization factor
inversion_method¶
lifetime_spectrum¶

Lifetime-spectrum of the calculated distance-distribution and the lifetime-spectrum of the donor reference sample

mfm.fitting.models.tcspc.fret module¶

class mfm.fitting.models.tcspc.fret.FRETModel(fit, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: mfm.fitting.models.tcspc.tcspc.LifetimeModel

distance_distribution¶

The distribution of distances. The distribution should be 3D numpy array of the form

gets distribution in form: (1,2,3) 0: number of distribution 1: amplitude 2: distance
donly¶

The fractions of donor-only (No-FRET) species. By default no donor-only is assumed. This has to be implemented by the model anyway.

donor_fluorescence_averaged_lifetime¶

The current species averaged lifetime of the donor sample xi*taui

donor_lifetime_spectrum¶

The donor lifetime spectrum in form amplitude, lifetime, amplitude, lifetime

donor_species_averaged_lifetime¶

The current species averaged lifetime of the donor sample xi*taui

donors¶
forster_radius¶

The Forster-radius of the FRET-pair

fret_fluorescence_averaged_lifetime¶

The current fluorescence averaged lifetime of the FRET-sample = xi*taui**2 / species_averaged_lifetime

fret_species_averaged_lifetime¶

The current species averages lifetime of the FRET sample xi * taui

get_transfer_efficency(phiD, phiA)[source]¶

Get the current donor-acceptor fluorescence intensity ratio :param phiD: float

donor quantum yield
Parameters:phiA – acceptor quantum yield
Returns:float, transfer efficency
kappa2¶

The mean orientation factor

lifetime_spectrum¶

This returns the lifetime-spectrum of the model including the donor-only offset (donor-only fraction)

rate_spectrum¶

The FRET-rate spectrum. This takes the distance distribution of the model and calculated the resulting FRET-rate spectrum (excluding the donor-offset).

reference¶
tau0¶

The lifetime of the donor in absence of additional quenching

transfer_efficiency¶

The current transfer efficency of the model (this includes donor-only)

update_model(**kwargs)[source]¶
class mfm.fitting.models.tcspc.fret.FRETrateModel(fit, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: mfm.fitting.models.tcspc.fret.FRETModel

This fit model is uses multiple discrete FRET rates to fit the Donor-decay. Here the donor lifetime- spectrum as well as the distances may be fitted. In this model it is assumed that each donor-species is fitted by the same FRET-rate distribution.

References

[R1]Kalinin, S., and Johansson, L.B., Energy Migration and Transfer Rates are Invariant to Modeling the Fluorescence Relaxation by Discrete and Continuous Distributions of Lifetimes. J. Phys. Chem. B, 108 (2004) 3092-3097.
append(mean, species_fraction)[source]¶

forster_radius¶

name = 'FRET: FD (Discrete)'¶

class mfm.fitting.models.tcspc.fret.GaussianModel(fit, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: mfm.fitting.models.tcspc.fret.FRETModel

This fit model is uses multiple Gaussian/normal distributions to fit the FRET-decay. Here the donor lifetime- spectrum as well as the distances may be fitted. In this model it is assumed that each donor-species is fitted by the same FRET-rate distribution.

References

[R2]Kalinin, S., and Johansson, L.B., Energy Migration and Transfer Rates are Invariant to Modeling the Fluorescence Relaxation by Discrete and Continuous Distributions of Lifetimes. J. Phys. Chem. B, 108 (2004) 3092-3097.
append(mean, sigma, species_fraction)[source]¶

class mfm.fitting.models.tcspc.pddem.PDDEM(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: mfm.parameter.AggregatedParameters

fAB¶
Returns:float probability of energy-transfer from A to B
fABBA¶
Returns:array probability of energy-transfer from (A to B), (B to A)
fBA¶
Returns:float probability of energy-transfer from B to A
name = 'PDDEM'¶
pm¶
Returns:array Emission probability of flurophore (A, B)
pmA¶
Returns:float Emission probability of flurophore A
pmB¶
Returns:float Emission probability of flurophore B
pureA¶
Returns:float fraction of decay A in total decay
pureAB¶
Returns:array fraction of decay (A, B) in total decay
pureB¶
Returns:float fraction of decay B in total decay
px¶
Returns:numpy-array Exciation probabilities of flurophore (A, B)
pxA¶
Returns:float Excitation probability of fluorphore A
pxB¶
Returns:float Excitation probability of fluorphore B
